alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 8:14PM CDT until July 19 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Flooding continues on the Sucarnoochee River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Friday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Some secondary low-lying roads and a few yards begin to flood in southeast Livingston. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Thursday was 20.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.3 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
